keyMoments.title: Ryuma Enters Hogback's Laboratory
keyMoments.description: Ryuma makes his debut entrance into Hogback's lab, displaying Brook's personality traits including his laugh and perverted behavior toward Nami, despite having no eyes.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of the legendary samurai's corpse animated with Brook's shadow, establishing him as a major threat in the Thriller Bark arc.
keyMoments.quote: What a beautiful lady! Even without eyes, I can appreciate such beauty!

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates Hanauta Sancho: Yahazu Giri
keyMoments.description: Ryuma uses Brook's signature delayed-strike sword technique for the first time, showcasing the full potential of the move when executed with a stronger body.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Ryuma's combat prowess and demonstrates how Brook's techniques are amplified when used by the legendary samurai's body.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Nami, Usopp, and Chopper
keyMoments.description: Ryuma effortlessly defeats three Straw Hat members with a single technique, knocking them unconscious and allowing them to be locked in a coffin.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the power gap between the Straw Hats and General Zombies, establishing Ryuma as a formidable antagonist.

statusHistory.reason: Animated as a zombie with Brook's shadow

abilities.description: A delayed-effect sword technique where the strike is so fast that victims don't realize they've been hit until several seconds later. Inherited from Brook's shadow.

relationships.description: Ryuma's zombie body is animated by Brook's stolen shadow, giving him access to Brook's personality traits and sword techniques.

evolutionMoments.description: Ryuma demonstrates Brook's mannerisms and techniques, revealing whose shadow animates him.

relationships.description: Ryuma serves as Hogback's personal bodyguard, following his orders to eliminate intruders.

evolutionMoments.description: Hogback orders Ryuma to kill the Straw Hats who discovered his laboratory.

reveals.information: The zombie is animated with Brook's shadow, explaining his personality and techniques
Can use Brook's signature sword technique Hanauta Sancho: Yahazu Giri with greater power
His body belongs to a legendary samurai from Wano Country who slayed a dragon

keyMoments.title: Risky Brothers Awakened by Absalom
keyMoments.description: The zombie Risky Brothers, a pair of squirrel zombies, are awakened along with other General Zombies to deal with the Straw Hat intruders.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of these recurring zombie characters who serve Perona and play a role in transporting captured Straw Hats.

reveals.information: Zombie squirrels animated with shadows from the Rolling Pirates' Risky Brothers

keyMoments.title: Gill Bastar Awakened as General Zombie
keyMoments.description: The four-armed General Zombie Gill Bastar is revealed among the elite zombies awakened by Absalom to combat the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a General Zombie whose body is later confirmed to be from the protagonist of Oda's one-shot manga 'Wanted,' representing an Easter egg connection to Oda's earlier work.

reveals.information: A four-armed General Zombie, later confirmed to have the body of the main character from Oda's 'Wanted' one-shot

name.japanese: キャプテン・ジョン（ゾンビ）

keyMoments.title: Captain John Appears as General Zombie
keyMoments.description: The legendary pirate Captain John, former member of the Rocks Pirates, is revealed as a drunk General Zombie among Absalom's elite forces.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a character with deep connections to One Piece lore, including the Rocks Pirates and the treasure subplot that will later involve Buggy the Clown.

statusHistory.reason: Animated as a General Zombie after being murdered by his crew

reveals.information: Former member of the legendary Rocks Pirates who accumulated a great treasure before being killed by his own crew for refusing to share it
Was murdered by his crew who stabbed him multiple times for not sharing his treasure

keyMoments.title: Ganzui Awakened as General Zombie
keyMoments.description: Ganzui, a large and imposing General Zombie, is awakened by Absalom along with the other elite zombie forces.
keyMoments.significance: Adds to the roster of powerful General Zombies threatening the Straw Hats.

reveals.information: A large, physically powerful General Zombie

keyMoments.title: Confronts Hogback About Zombie Creation
keyMoments.description: Nami takes the lead in confronting Dr. Hogback after discovering evidence of his zombie experiments in Cindry's quarters.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nami's courage in standing up to unethical practices and seeking the truth despite danger.
keyMoments.quote: We found evidence in Cindry's quarters. You're creating zombies!

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Ryuma
keyMoments.description: Nami is knocked unconscious by Ryuma's delayed-strike technique along with Usopp and Chopper, then locked in a coffin.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the power gap between the Straw Hats and elite enemies, removing Nami from action temporarily.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Ryuma
keyMoments.description: Usopp is knocked unconscious by Ryuma's Hanauta Sancho: Yahazu Giri technique and locked in a coffin with Nami and Chopper.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's vulnerability against powerful swordsmen and elite zombies.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Ryuma
keyMoments.description: Chopper is knocked unconscious by Ryuma's delayed sword technique along with his companions and imprisoned in a coffin.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's limitations against elite swordsmen.

name.japanese: ドクトル・ホグバック

keyMoments.title: Cindry's Death Revealed
keyMoments.description: The truth about Victoria Cindry's death and Hogback's obsession with her is revealed, including his failed proposal and her death 10-12 years ago.
keyMoments.significance: Exposes Hogback's true motivations for joining Moria and creating zombies.

keyMoments.title: Orders Attack on Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Hogback drops his facade and orders Ryuma and Cindry to kill Nami, Usopp, and Chopper after they discover his laboratory.
keyMoments.significance: Fully reveals Hogback's villainous nature and lack of medical ethics.
keyMoments.quote: It doesn't matter what you saw! The Night Attack is about to begin. Cindry! Ryuma! Kill them!

reveals.information: Proposed to Victoria Cindry while she was alive but was rejected because she had a fiancé
Joined Gecko Moria specifically to have Cindry resurrected as a zombie
